name: Certificate of Graduate Study in Early Childhood Coaching & Technical Assistance

Certificate of Graduate Study in Early C: Certificate of Graduate Study in Early Childhood Coaching & Technical Assistance The Certificate of Graduate Study (COGS) in Early Childhood Coaching and Technical Assistance is designed to support professionals and leaders in early childhood education and create a career pathway and professional development for leadership in the form of technical assistance, coaching and mentoring in the field. This program offers a formal, credit-bearing training for technical assistance specialists, coaches and mentors, as well as, other professionals in leadership roles in early childhood education, such as early childhood program directors, supervisors, master teachers, kindergarten coaches, and consultants who would like to build capacity as a leader guiding quality improvement in early childhood programs. This program will not lead to certification. Teachers in the state of New Jersey may apply to the Certificate of Graduate Study in Early Childhood Coaching and Technical Assistance program through the New Jersey Teacher Outreach Program (NJTOP®️).

notes: Total Required Credits for the Program: 15 s.h. Foundation Courses None Graduation/Exit, Benchmark, and/or Thesis Requirements None Minimum Required Grades and Cumulative GPA The Certificate of Graduate Study in Early Childhood Coaching & Technical Assistance is a Category 2 program.
